info.name: Advanced Server Access API
info.description:
The Advanced Server Access API is a control plane API for operations in Okta Advanced Server Access (formerly ScaleFT)

Contact Support:
 Name: Okta Support
 Email: support@okta.com

item.name: List the Audits for a Team

query.description: The number of objects per page.

request.description:
List the Audits for a Team.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `reporting_user`, `access_user`, `access_admin`.

response.name: List of Audits

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

query.description: The number of objects per page.
When 'true', returns all Clients for the Team.
List Clients assigned to a single User. An empty string returns unassigned Clients.

request.description:
By default returns the ASA Clients for the requesting ASA User. Query options can be provided to filter by ASA User or state.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_user`, `access_admin`, `reporting_user`.

response.name: List of ASA Clients.

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

request.description:
Revoke an ASA Client's access to this Team

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_user`, `access_admin`, `authenticated_client`.

response.name: The ASA Client was revoked successfully.

request.description:
Returns a single ASA Client associated with the ID in the path.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`, `reporting_user`, `access_user`.

response.name: The ASA Client that was requested.

item.name: Approve or assign an ASA Client

request.description:
Used for ASA Clients enrolled using a token policy or a policy that requires approval

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The ASA Client was updated successfully.

item.name: List the sudo Entitlements for a team

query.description: The number of objects per page.

request.description:
This endpoint lists the sudo Entitlements for a team.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: List of sudo Entitlements.

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

request.description:
This endpoint creates a sudo Entitlement, corresponding to a set of commands that can be run as sudo for a selected group.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The sudo Entitlement that was created.

variable.description: (Required) The UUID of the Sudo Entitlement.

request.description:
This endpoint deletes the sudo Entitlement corresponding to the provided ID. The Entitlement must not be assigned to any Project in order to be deleted.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The sudo Entitlement was deleted successfully.

variable.description: (Required) The UUID of the Sudo Entitlement.

request.description:
This endpoint fetches the sudo Entitlement corresponding to the provided ID.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The sudo Entitlement that was requested.

variable.description: (Required) The UUID of the Sudo Entitlement.

request.description:
This endpoint updates the sudo Entitlement corresponding to the provided ID.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The sudo Entitlement was updated successfully.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`, `access_user`, `reporting_user`.

response.name: List of ASA Groups.

item.name: Remove an ASA Group from Team

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The ASA Group was removed successfully.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `reporting_user`, `access_admin`, `access_user`.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The ASA Group was updated successfully.

item.name: List ASA Users of an ASA Group

query.description: The number of objects per page.
Includes ASA Users with name that begins with the value.
Includes ASA Users with specified statuses. Valid statuses are 'ACTIVE', 'DISABLED', and 'DELETED'.
Includes ASA Users with name that contains the value.
Includes ASA Users of the specified type. Valid types are 'human' and 'service'.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `reporting_user`, `access_user`, `access_admin`.

response.name: List of ASA Users.

request.description:
Create a Project

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The Project that was created.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The Project was deleted successfully.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`, `authenticated_client`, `client`, `reporting_user`, `access_user`.

item.name: List Client Configuration Options for a Project

request.description:
Use Client Configuration Options to automatically pass settings to any Client logging into a server in this Project.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_user`, `access_admin`.

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

item.name: Add Client Configuration Options for a Project

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The Client Configuration Option was created

item.name: Remove a Client Configuration Option from a Project

variable.description: (Required) The UUID of the Client Config Options.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The Client Configuration Option was successfully deleted

item.name: List Cloud Accounts in a Project

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_user`, `reporting_user`.

response.name: List of Cloud Accounts in a Project

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

item.name: Add a Cloud Account to a Project

request.description:
Adding a Cloud Account to a Project allows servers created in that account to register with Okta Advanced Server Access without using a Server Enrollment Token. This is only possible on cloud providers that expose cryptographically signed instance metadata so this is currently restricted to AWS and GCE.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: Cloud Account that was added to the Project

item.name: Remove a Cloud Account from a Project

variable.description: (Required) The UUID of the Cloud Account.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The Cloud Account was removed successfully.

item.name: List all the ASA Groups in a Project

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `reporting_user`, `access_user`, `access_admin`.

response.name: List of ASA Groups in the specified Project

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

item.name: Add an ASA Group to a Project

request.description:
Adds a pre-existing ASA Group to the Project, enabling server access, with either user or admin permissions and the option to sync an ASA Group to the servers in the Project.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The ASA Group was successfully added to the Project.

item.name: Remove an ASA Group from a Project

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The ASA Group was successfully removed from the Project.

item.name: Retrieve ASA Group details for a single Project

request.description:
Returns details for an ASA Group on an Project.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `reporting_user`, `access_user`, `access_admin`.

response.name: The Project Group requested

item.name: Change the Project properties of an ASA Project Group

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The ASA Project Group was successfully updated in the Project.

request.description:
A Preauthorization is a time-limited grant for an ASA User to access resources in a specific Project.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `preauthorization`, `access_admin`.

response.name: The Preauthorization requested

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`, `preauthorization`.

response.name: The Preauthorization was created successfully.

item.name: Lists the Preauthorizations for a Project

query.description: The number of objects per page.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`, `preauthorization`.

response.name: List of Preauthorizations

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `preauthorization`, `access_admin`.

response.name: The updated Preauthorization

item.name: Fetch a Server Enrollment Token from a Project

item.name: List Server Users in a Project

request.description:
A Server User is a representation of a given ASA User that that will be realized on an end server.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_user`, `access_admin`, `reporting_user`.

response.name: List of Server Users

Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `reporting_user`, `access_user`, `access_admin`.

response.name: Server User

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

request.description:
The Servers enrolled in this Project

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_user`, `access_admin`, `server_admin`.

response.name: List of Servers

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

item.name: Add an Unmanaged Server to a Project

request.description:
Unmanaged Servers don't use Advanced Server Access for authentication, but still receive Client Configuration Options. Create an Unmanaged Server in order to control the options your team members use to connect to appliances, especially bastions which can't fully utilize Advanced Server Access.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`, `server_admin`.

response.name: The created unmanaged server.

item.name: Remove a Server from a Project

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`, `server_admin`.

response.name: The Server has been removed.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_user`, `access_admin`, `server_admin`.

response.name: The server object requested

query.description: The number of objects per page.
A cloud provider. Can be 'aws' or 'gcp'
Include Servers that contain the value of 'alt_name_contains' in their 'alt_names'
State of the Server. Can be 'ACTIVE' or 'INACTIVE'

request.description:
Lists all the Servers enrolled in a Team to which the requesting ASA User has access.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `reporting_user`, `server_admin`, `access_user`, `access_admin`, `authenticated_client`.

response.name: List of servers.

header.description:
Link Header defined by RFC 8288.

A Link header with rel="next" indicates that a subsequent page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

A Link header with rel="prev" indicates that a previous page is available and contains the URL which should be used to fetch it.

request.description:
Fetch Team-level settings for a specific Team, such as authentication and enrollment details.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_user`, `access_admin`, `instance_admin`.

response.name: The Team settings requested

request.description:
Update team-level settings. Partial updates are permitted. URL parameters are optional and default to unset. To unset a previously-set URL, PUT with the value set to `null`.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`, `instance_admin`.

response.name: The Team settings was successfully updated.

request.description:
Provides some general statistics regarding a Team.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The statistics for the Team

request.description:
Most calls to the Okta Advanced Server Access API require an HTTP Authorization header with a value of the form `Bearer ${AUTH_TOKEN}`.
To retrieve an auth token, you'll need to [create a service user and API key](https://help.okta.com/en/prod/okta_help_CSH.htm#ext_asa_service_users), then pass the API key information to this endpoint.
Auth tokens may expire at any time, so code using them should be prepared to handle a 401 response code by creating a new one.

response.name: On success, the call will return a JSON object with the bearer token and its expiration date.

request.description:
Rotating an API key will automatically set an expiration date on the rest of the API keys a Service User has.

This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: The new API key and secret.

variable.description: (Required) The UUID of the Service User key.

request.description: This endpoint requires one of the following roles: `access_admin`.

response.name: API key has been successfully deleted.
